      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(int[][] d)
        Overloaded constructor method for the Matrix object. Initialized with a two dimensional array with the data you wish to be in the matrix.
        Parameters:
        d - the two dimensional array with the relevant data

    • Method Detail

      • MatrixToArr

        public static int[][] MatrixToArr​(Matrix m)
        This method takes in a matrix m, and returns a two dimensional array holding the same data as the matrix. This is helpful when encrypting and decrypting a message.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix you wish to have as a two dimensional array
        Returns:
        returns a two dimensional array holding the same data as m

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • times

        public Matrix times​(Matrix m)
        This method computes matrix multiplication. For the purpose of this cypher, the matrix multiplication is then taken mod 26.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to be multiplied by this matrix.
        Returns:
        returns a new matrix that is the result of the multiplication.

      • Determinant

        public static int Determinant​(Matrix m)
        This method calculates the determinant of a 2x2 matrix. If the matrix is not 2x2, it returns an error.
        Parameters:
        m - the 2x2 matrix we wish to compute the determinant of
        Returns:
        returns the double value of the determinant.

      • InverseKey

        public static Matrix InverseKey​(Matrix key)
        This method finds the inverse matrix of a 2x2 matrix, if one exists. If the matrix is not invertible, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        key - the matrix that needs to be inverted. In our case, this matrix will always be the key for the cypher.
        Returns:
        returns a new matrix that is the inverse of key
